member.name: T:Atata.FindAttribute
member.summary: Represents the base attribute class for the finding attributes.

member.name: P:Atata.FindAttribute.Index
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the control. The default value is -1, meaning that the index is not used.

member.name: P:Atata.FindAttribute.Visibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility. The default value is .

member.name: P:Atata.FindAttribute.ScopeSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the scope source. The default value is .

member.name: P:Atata.FindAttribute.OuterXPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the outer XPath. The default value is , meaning that the control is searchable as descendant (using ".//" XPath) in scope source.

member.name: P:Atata.FindAttribute.Strategy
member.summary: Gets or sets the strategy type for the control search. Strategy type should implement . The default value is , meaning that the default strategy of the specific should be used.

member.name: P:Atata.FindAttribute.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the element find timeout in seconds. The default value is taken from property of .

member.name: P:Atata.FindAttribute.RetryInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the element find retry interval in seconds. The default value is taken from property of .

member.name: P:Atata.FindAttribute.As
member.summary: Gets or sets the way this should be used. The default value is . Each control can have 1 with value and many other s with another values, which are used as layers. When several layer attributes are used, then property can be used to specify an order of each attribute.

member.name: P:Atata.FindAttribute.Layer
member.summary: Gets or sets the layer order of find attribute. It is useful to specify the order of the layer when several layers are used. This property is used only paired with property set to any value except . The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Atata.FindAttribute.DefaultStrategy
member.summary: Gets the default strategy type for the control search. Strategy type should implement .

member.name: M:Atata.FindAttribute.CreateStrategy(Atata.UIComponentMetadata)
member.summary: Creates the strategy.

member.name: T:Atata.FindAttributeExtensions
member.summary: Provides a set of extension methods for .

member.name: T:Atata.FindByAltAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a control should be found by the alt attribute. Finds the control that has the alt attribute matching the specified term(s). Uses as the default term case.

member.name: T:Atata.FindByAttributeAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a control should be found by the specified attribute. Finds the control that has the specified attribute matching the specified term(s). Uses as the default term case.

member.name: T:Atata.FindByChildContentAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a control should be found by the child content text. Finds the control having the child with the specified content. Uses as the default term case.

member.name: P:Atata.FindByChildContentAttribute.ChildIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the child element. The default value is 0.

member.name: T:Atata.FindByClassAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a control should be found by class attribute. Finds the descendant or self control in the scope of the element having the specified class. Uses as the default term case.

member.name: T:Atata.FindByColumnHeaderAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a control should be found within the table column (<td>) that has the header (<th>) matching the specified term(s). Uses as the default term case.

member.name: T:Atata.FindByColumnIndexAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a control should be found within the table column (<td>) that has the nth index.

member.name: T:Atata.FindByContentAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a control should be found by the content text. Finds the control having the specified content. Uses as the default term case.

member.name: T:Atata.FindByContentOrValueAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a control should be found by the content text or value attribute. Finds the control that has the content or value attribute matching the specified term(s). Uses as the default term case.

member.name: T:Atata.FindByCssAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a control should be found by CSS selector. Finds the descendant or self control in the scope of the element found by the specified CSS selector.

member.name: P:Atata.FindByCssAttribute.Values
member.summary: Gets the CSS selector values.

member.name: T:Atata.FindByDescendantAttributeAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a control should be found by the specified attribute of any control's descendant. Finds the control that has any descendant having specified attribute matching the specified term(s). Uses as the default term case.

member.name: T:Atata.FindByDescendantIdAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a control should be found by the id attribute of any control's descendant. Finds the control that has any descendant having id matching the specified term(s). Uses as the default term case.

member.name: T:Atata.FindByDescriptionTermAttribute

member.name: T:Atata.FindByLabelAttribute

member.name: T:Atata.FindByNameAttribute

member.name: T:Atata.FindByPlaceholderAttribute

member.name: T:Atata.FindByScriptAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a control should be found by specific script. The script should return an element or collection of elements. The script can also return null for the case when the element is not found. The scope element is passed to the script as an argument and can be used in the script as arguments[0].

example.code: [FindByScript("return document.querySelector('input[type=radio][value=OptionA]')")] public RadioButton<_> OptionA { get; private set; }

summary.para: Sets up driver with auto version detection for the local browser to use. Gets the name of the local browser to use from property. Then invokes Atata.WebDriverSetup.DriverSetup.AutoSetUpSafely(...) static method from Atata.WebDriverSetup package.
In order to use this method, ensure that Atata.WebDriverSetup package is installed.

member.name: M:Atata.AtataContextBuilder.AutoSetUpDriverToUseAsync

summary.para: Sets up driver with auto version detection for the local browser to use. Gets the name of the local browser to use from property. Then invokes Atata.WebDriverSetup.DriverSetup.AutoSetUpSafely(...) static method from Atata.WebDriverSetup package.
In order to use this method, ensure that Atata.WebDriverSetup package is installed.

member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

summary.para: Sets up drivers with auto version detection for the local configured browsers. Gets the names of configured local browsers from property. Then invokes Atata.WebDriverSetup.DriverSetup.AutoSetUpSafely(...) static method from Atata.WebDriverSetup package.

member.summary: Specifies the host name of the service. The default value is "localhost". This configuration option makes sense for .NET Core 2.0 to be set to "127.0.0.1" for IPv4 and "[::1]" for IPv6. There is a bug (https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/24104) in .NET Core 2.0: each WebDriver request takes extra 1 second.

member.name: M:Atata.DriverAtataContextBuilder`3.WithFixOfCommandExecutionDelay
member.summary: Specifies that the fix of driver's HTTP command execution delay should be applied. Invokes WithHostName("127.0.0.1") method. This configuration option makes sense for .NET Core 2.0 that works within IPv4. There is a bug (https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/24104) in .NET Core 2.0: each WebDriver request takes extra 1 second.

member.name: M:Atata.ScreenshotConsumersAtataContextBuilder.AddFile
member.summary: Adds the instance for the screenshot saving to file. By default uses directory as a directory path format, "{screenshot-number:D2} - {screenshot-pageobjectname} {screenshot-pageobjecttypename}{screenshot-title: - *}" as a file name format and as an image format. Example of a screenshot file path using default settings: "artifacts\20220303T143404\SampleTest\01 - Home page - Screenshot title.png". Available predefined path variables are: {build-start}, {build-start-utc} {test-name}, {test-name-sanitized}, {test-suite-name}, {test-suite-name-sanitized}, {test-start}, {test-start-utc}, {driver-alias}, {screenshot-number}, {screenshot-title}, {screenshot-pageobjectname}, {screenshot-pageobjecttypename}, {screenshot-pageobjectfullname}. Path variables support formatting.

member.name: T:Atata.FileScreenshotConsumer
member.summary: Represents the screenshot consumer that saves the screenshot to the file. By default uses directory as a directory path format, "{screenshot-number:D2} - {screenshot-pageobjectname} {screenshot-pageobjecttypename}{screenshot-title: - *}" as a file name format and as an image format. Example of a screenshot file path using default settings: "artifacts\20220303T143404\SampleTest\01 - Home page - Screenshot title.png". Available predefined path variables are: {build-start}, {build-start-utc} {test-name}, {test-name-sanitized}, {test-suite-name}, {test-suite-name-sanitized}, {test-start}, {test-start-utc}, {driver-alias}, {screenshot-number}, {screenshot-title}, {screenshot-pageobjectname}, {screenshot-pageobjecttypename}, {screenshot-pageobjectfullname}. Path variables support formatting.
